title.narrative: Collective Action Against Hunger and Poverty in the Eastern Region

description.narrative: This project will help 600 families in the eastern region of Nepal improve their nutrition. Heifer International will provide 250 original project families with 150 water buffaloes, 200 goats and 5 bucks. Families will also be given the agricultural support of fodder and forage seeds, along with saplings and vegetable seeds for kitchen gardening. An additional 350 families will benefit through Passing on the Gift. All project participants will receive trainings on fodder and forage production, gender justice, Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones, HIV/AIDS awareness, improved animal management, kitchen gardening and organic farming, maternal and child healthcare and self-help group management. To protect the environment, 40 families will receive biogas units and improved toilets. Heifer will train two village animal health workers and will provide basic veterinary equipment and supplies. This project will also form youth groups in the project areas and provide Cornerstone training to increase the groups’ capacities. Through this project, participating communities will significantly improve their living conditions and eliminate barriers to social unity in order to make a healthier, more just and sustainable society. A powerful effect of the Cornerstones and other trainings is that the traditional discrimination between castes and against women falls away, and communities come together in harmony. Women rise to leadership positions, and communities learn how to work together effectively to bring themselves out of huger and poverty.
